alert.note: Alert for Smyth (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 15 at 4:01PM EDT until August 15 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following county, Smyth. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 359 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Georges Branch, Dulton Branch, Cripple Creek, Blue Spring Creek, Crewey Branch, Hungry Mother Creek, Beaver Creek, Dry Creek, Comers Creek, East Fork Hopkins Branch, Killinger Creek, Deans Branch, Campbell Creek, Kinser Creek and Dickey Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area, with locally higher amounts possible. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marion... Saltville... Chilhowie... Mount Rogers National Recreation Area... Sugar Grove... Hungry Mother State Park... Adwolf... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
